   19: %%
   20: %% %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
   21: %% This test suite uses the following external programs:
   22: %%     snmpget    From packet 'snmp' (in Ubuntu 12.04)
   23: %%     snmpd      From packet 'snmpd' (in Ubuntu 12.04)
   24: %%     snmptrapd  From packet 'snmpd' (in Ubuntu 12.04)
   25: %% They originate from the Net-SNMP applications, see:
   26: %%     http://net-snmp.sourceforge.net/
   27: 
   28: 
   29: -module(snmp_to_snmpnet_SUITE).
   30: 
   31: -export([
   32:          suite/0, all/0, groups/0,
   33:          init_per_suite/1,    end_per_suite/1,
   34:          init_per_group/2,    end_per_group/2, 
   35:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   36: 
   37:          erlang_agent_netsnmp_get/0,    erlang_agent_netsnmp_get/1,
   38:          erlang_agent_netsnmp_inform/0, erlang_agent_netsnmp_inform/1,
   39:          erlang_manager_netsnmp_get/0,  erlang_manager_netsnmp_get/1
   40: 
   41:         ]).
   42: 
   43: -include("snmp_test_lib.hrl").
   44: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   45: -include_lib("snmp/include/STANDARD-MIB.hrl").
   46: 
   47: -define(AGENT_ENGINE_ID, "ErlangSnmpAgent").
   48: -define(MANAGER_ENGINE_ID, "ErlangSnmpManager").
   49: -define(AGENT_PORT, 4000).
   50: -define(MANAGER_PORT, 8989).
   51: -define(DEFAULT_MAX_MESSAGE_SIZE, 484).
   52: 
   53: expected(?sysDescr_instance = Oid, get) ->
   54:     OidStr = oid_str(Oid),
   55:     lists:flatten([OidStr | " = STRING: \"Erlang SNMP agent\""]).
   56: 
   57: 
   58: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   59: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
   60: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   61: 
   62: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   63: 
   64: all() -> 
   65:     [
   66:      {group, ipv4},
   67:      {group, ipv6},
   68:      {group, ipv4_ipv6}
   69:     ].
   70: 
   71: groups() ->
   72:     [
   73:      {ipv4,      [], ipv4_cases()},
   74:      {ipv6,      [], ipv6_cases()},
   75:      {ipv4_ipv6, [], ipv4_ipv6_cases()},
   76: 
   77:      {snmpget,   [], snmpget_cases()},
   78:      {snmptrapd, [], snmptrapd_cases()},
   79:      {snmpd_mt,  [], snmpd_mt_cases()},
   80:      {snmpd,     [], snmpd_cases()}
   81:     ].
   82: 
   83: ipv4_cases() ->
   84:     [
   85:      {group, snmpget},
   86:      {group, snmptrapd},
   87:      {group, snmpd_mt},
   88:      {group, snmpd}
   89:     ].
   90: 
   91: ipv6_cases() ->
   92:     [
   93:      {group, snmpget},
   94:      {group, snmptrapd},
   95:      {group, snmpd_mt},
   96:      {group, snmpd}
   97:     ].
   98: 
   99: ipv4_ipv6_cases() ->
  100:      [
  101:       {group, snmpget},
  102:       {group, snmptrapd},
  103:       {group, snmpd_mt},
  104:       {group, snmpd}
  105:      ].
  106: 
  107: snmpget_cases() ->
  108:     [
  109:      erlang_agent_netsnmp_get
  110:     ].
  111: 
  112: snmptrapd_cases() ->
  113:     [
  114:      erlang_agent_netsnmp_inform
  115:     ].
  116: 
  117: snmpd_mt_cases() ->
  118:     [
  119:      erlang_manager_netsnmp_get
  120:     ].
  121: 
  122: snmpd_cases() ->
  123:     [
  124:      erlang_manager_netsnmp_get
  125:     ].
  126: 
  127: 
  128: 
  129: %%
  130: %% -----
  131: %%
  132: 
  133: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  134:     ?IPRINT("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  135:             "~n   Config: ~p", [Config0]),
  136: 
  137:     case netsnmp_init(Config0) of
  138:         {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  139:             SKIP;
  140: 
  141:         Config1 ->
  142:             case ?LIB:init_per_suite(Config1) of
  143:                 {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  144:                     SKIP;
  145: 
  146:                 Config2 when is_list(Config2) ->
  147:                     snmp_test_sys_monitor:start(),
  148:                     
  149:                     ?IPRINT("init_per_suite -> end when"
  150:                             "~n      Config: ~p", [Config2]),
  151: 
  152:                     Config2
  153:             end
  154:     end.
  155: 
  156: netsnmp_init(Config) ->
  157:     case has_netsnmp() of
  158:         true ->
  159:             case proper_netsnmp_version() of
  160:                 true ->
  161:                     [{agent_port,   ?AGENT_PORT},
  162:                      {manager_port, ?MANAGER_PORT} | Config];
  163:                 false ->
  164:                     {skip, "Buggy NetSNMP"}
  165:             end;
  166:         false ->
  167:             {skip, "No NetSNMP"}
  168:     end.
  169: 
  170: has_netsnmp() ->
  171:     netsnmp_check("NET-SNMP").
  172: 
  173: proper_netsnmp_version() ->
  174:     not netsnmp_check("5.4|5.6.2.1").
  175: 
  176: netsnmp_check(RE) ->
  177:     case re:run(os:cmd("snmpd -v"), RE, [{capture, first}]) of
  178:         nomatch ->
  179:             false;
  180:         {match, _} ->
  181:             true
  182:     end.
  183: 
  184: 
  185: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  186:     ?IPRINT("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  187:             "~n   Config: ~p", [Config]),
  188: 
  189:     snmp_test_sys_monitor:stop(),
  190:     ?LIB:end_per_suite(Config),
  191: 
  192:     ?IPRINT("end_per_suite -> end"),
  193: 
  194:     Config.
  195: 
  196: %%
  197: %% -----
  198: %%
  199: 
  200: init_per_group(ipv4, Config) ->
  201:     init_per_group_ip([inet], Config);
  202: init_per_group(ipv6, Config) ->
  203:     case os:type() of
  204: 	{unix, netbsd} ->
  205: 	    {skip, "Host *may* not *properly* support IPV6"};
  206: 	_ ->
  207: 	    init_per_group_ipv6([inet6], Config)
  208:     end;
  209: init_per_group(ipv4_ipv6, Config) ->
  210:     case os:type() of
  211: 	{unix, netbsd} ->
  212: 	    {skip, "Host *may* not *properly* support IPV6"};
  213: 	_ ->
  214: 	    init_per_group_ipv6([inet, inet6], Config)
  215:     end;
  216: init_per_group(snmpget = Exec, Config) ->
  217:     %% From Ubuntu package snmp
  218:     init_per_group_agent(Exec, Config);
  219: init_per_group(snmptrapd = Exec, Config) ->
  220:     %% From Ubuntu package snmpd
  221:     init_per_group_agent(Exec, Config);
  222: init_per_group(snmpd_mt, Config) ->
  223:     %% From Ubuntu package snmp
  224:     init_per_group_manager(
  225:       snmpd,
  226:       [{manager_net_if_module, snmpm_net_if_mt} | Config]);
  227: init_per_group(snmpd = Exec, Config) ->
  228:     %% From Ubuntu package snmp
  229:     init_per_group_manager(
  230:       Exec,
  231:       [{manager_net_if_module, snmpm_net_if} | Config]);
  232: 
  233: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
  234:     Config.
  235: 
  236: init_per_group_ipv6(Families, Config) ->
  237:     case ?HAS_SUPPORT_IPV6() of
  238:         true ->
  239:             init_per_group_ip(Families, Config);
  240:         false ->
  241:             {skip, "Host does not support IPv6"}
  242:     end.
  243: 
  244: init_per_group_ip(Families, Config) ->
  245:     AgentPort = ?config(agent_port, Config),
  246:     ManagerPort = ?config(manager_port, Config),
  247:     Transports =
  248: 	[begin
  249:              Addr = ?LIB:localhost(Family),
  250: 	     {domain(Family), {Addr, AgentPort}}
  251: 	 end || Family <- Families],
  252:     Targets =
  253: 	[begin
  254:              Addr = ?LIB:localhost(Family),
  255: 	     {domain(Family), {Addr, ManagerPort}}
  256: 	 end || Family <- Families],
  257:     [{transports, Transports}, {targets, Targets} | Config].
  258: 
  259: init_per_group_agent(Exec, Config) ->
  260:     Versions = [v2],
  261:     Dir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  262:     Transports = ?config(transports, Config),
  263:     Targets = ?config(targets, Config),
  264:     agent_config(Dir, Transports, Targets, Versions),
  265:     find_executable(Exec, [{snmp_versions, Versions} | Config]).
  266: 
  267: init_per_group_manager(Exec, Config) ->
  268:     Versions = [v2],
  269:     Dir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  270:     Targets = ?config(targets, Config),
  271:     manager_config(Dir, Targets),
  272:     find_executable(Exec, [{snmp_versions, Versions} | Config]).
  273: 
  274: 
  275: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  276:     Config.
  277: 
  278: 
  279: 
  280: %%
  281: %% -----
  282: %%
  283: 
  284: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
  285:     ?IPRINT("init_per_testcase -> entry with"
  286:             "~n   Config: ~p", [Config]),
  287: 
  288:     snmp_test_global_sys_monitor:reset_events(),
  289: 
  290:     Dog = ct:timetrap(?SECS(20)),
  291:     application:stop(snmp),
  292:     application:unload(snmp),
  293:     Config1 = [{watchdog, Dog} | Config],
  294: 
  295:     ?IPRINT("init_per_testcase -> done when"
  296:             "~n   Config: ~p", [Config1]),
  297: 
  298:     Config1.
  299: 
  300: end_per_testcase(_, Config) ->
  301: 
  302:     ?IPRINT("end_per_testcase -> entry with"
  303:             "~n   Config:  ~p", [Config]),
  304: 
  305:     ?IPRINT("system events during test: "
  306:             "~n   ~p", [snmp_test_global_sys_monitor:events()]),
  307: 
  308:     case application:stop(snmp) of
  309: 	ok ->
  310: 	    ok;
  311: 	E1 ->
  312: 	    ct:pal("application:stop(snmp) -> ~p", [E1])
  313:     end,
  314:     case application:unload(snmp) of
  315: 	ok ->
  316: 	    ok;
  317: 	E2 ->
  318: 	    ct:pal("application:unload(snmp) -> ~p", [E2])
  319:     end,
  320: 
  321:     ?IPRINT("end_per_testcase -> done with"
  322:             "~n   Config: ~p", [Config]),
  323: 
  324:     Config.
  325: 
  326: find_executable(Exec, Config) ->
  327:     ExecStr = atom_to_list(Exec),
  328:     case os:find_executable(ExecStr) of
  329: 	false ->
  330: 	    %% The sbin dirs are not in the PATH on all platforms...
  331: 	    find_sys_executable(
  332: 	      Exec, ExecStr,
  333: 	      [["usr", "local", "sbin"],
  334: 	       ["usr", "sbin"],
  335: 	       ["sbin"]],
  336: 	     Config);
  337: 	Path ->
  338: 	    [{Exec, Path} | Config]
  339:     end.
  340: 
  341: find_sys_executable(_Exec, ExecStr, [], _Config) ->
  342:     {skip, ExecStr ++ " not found"};
  343: find_sys_executable(Exec, ExecStr, [Dir | Dirs], Config) ->
  344:     case os:find_executable(filename:join(["/" | Dir] ++ [ExecStr])) of
  345: 	false ->
  346: 	    find_sys_executable(Exec, ExecStr, Dirs, Config);
  347: 	Path ->
  348: 	    [{Exec, Path} | Config]
  349:     end.
  350: 
  351: start_agent(Config) ->
  352:     ok = application:load(snmp),
  353:     ok = application:set_env(snmp, agent, agent_app_env(Config)),
  354:     ok = application:start(snmp).
  355: 
  356: %% stop_agent(_Config) ->
  357: %%     case application:stop(snmp) of
  358: %% 	ok ->
  359: %% 	    ok;
  360: %% 	E1 ->
  361: %% 	    ct:pal("application:stop(snmp) -> ~p", [E1])
  362: %%     end,
  363: %%     case application:unload(snmp) of
  364: %% 	ok ->
  365: %% 	    ok;
  366: %% 	E2 ->
  367: %% 	    ct:pal("application:unload(snmp) -> ~p", [E2])
  368: %%     end.
  369: 
  370: start_manager(Config) ->
  371:     ok = application:load(snmp),
  372:     ok = application:set_env(snmp, manager, manager_app_env(Config)),
  373:     ok = application:start(snmp).
  374: 
  375: %% stop_manager(_Config) ->
  376: %%     case application:stop(snmp) of
  377: %% 	ok ->
  378: %% 	    ok;
  379: %% 	E1 ->
  380: %% 	    ct:pal("application:stop(snmp) -> ~p", [E1])
  381: %%     end,
  382: %%     case application:unload(snmp) of
  383: %% 	ok ->
  384: %% 	    ok;
  385: %% 	E2 ->
  386: %% 	    ct:pal("application:unload(snmp) -> ~p", [E2])
  387: %%     end.
  388: 
  389: 
  390: 
  391: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  392: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  393: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  394: erlang_agent_netsnmp_get() ->
  395:     [{doc,"Test that we can access erlang snmp agent " 
  396:       "from snmpnet manager"}].
  397: 
  398: erlang_agent_netsnmp_get(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  399:     Transports = ?config(transports, Config),
  400:     start_agent(Config),
  401:     Oid = ?sysDescr_instance,
  402:     Expected = expected(Oid, get),
  403:     try
  404:         begin
  405:             [case snmpget(Oid, Transport, Config) of
  406:                  Expected ->
  407:                      ct:pal("Received expected", []),
  408:                      ok;
  409:                  "Timeout: " ++ Rest ->
  410:                      ct:pal("Received unexpected timeout: "
  411:                             "~n   ~s", [Rest]),
  412:                      throw({skip, Rest});
  413:                  Any ->
  414:                      ct:pal("Received unexpected response: "
  415:                             "~n   ~p", [Any]),
  416:                      exit({unexpected, Any})
  417:              end || Transport <- Transports],
  418:             ok
  419:         end
  420:     catch
  421:         throw:{skip, _} = SKIP ->
  422:             SKIP
  423:     end.
  424: 
  425: 
  426: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  427: erlang_manager_netsnmp_get() ->
  428:     [{doc,"Test that the erlang snmp manager can access snmpnet agent"}].
  429: 
  430: erlang_manager_netsnmp_get(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  431:     Community  = "happy-testing",
  432:     SysDescr   = "Net-SNMP agent",
  433:     TargetName = "Target Net-SNMP agent",
  434:     Transports = ?config(transports, Config),
  435:     case start_snmpd(Community, SysDescr, Config) of
  436:         {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  437:             SKIP;
  438:         ProgHandle ->
  439:             start_manager(Config),
  440:             snmp_manager_user:start_link(self(), test_user),
  441:             [snmp_manager_user:register_agent(
  442:                TargetName++domain_suffix(Domain),
  443:                [{reg_type, target_name},
  444:                 {tdomain, Domain}, {taddress, Addr},
  445:                 {community, Community}, {engine_id, "EngineId"},
  446:                 {version, v2}, {sec_model, v2c}, {sec_level, noAuthNoPriv}])
  447:              || {Domain, Addr} <- Transports],
  448:             Results =
  449:                 [snmp_manager_user:sync_get2(
  450:                    TargetName++domain_suffix(Domain),
  451:                    [?sysDescr_instance], [])
  452:                  || {Domain, _} <- Transports],
  453:             ct:pal("sync_get -> ~p", [Results]),
  454:             snmp_manager_user:stop(),
  455:             stop_program(ProgHandle),
  456:             [{ok,
  457:               {noError, 0,
  458:                [{varbind, ?sysDescr_instance, 'OCTET STRING', SysDescr,1}] },
  459:               _} = R || R <- Results],
  460:             ok
  461:     end.
  462: 
  463: 
  464: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  465: erlang_agent_netsnmp_inform() ->
  466:     [{doc, "TBD"}].
  467: 
  468: erlang_agent_netsnmp_inform(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  469:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir, Config),
  470:     Mib = "TestTrapv2",
  471: 
  472:     start_agent(Config),
  473:     ok = snmpa:load_mib(snmp_master_agent, filename:join(DataDir, Mib)),
  474: 
  475:     case start_snmptrapd(Mib, Config) of
  476:         {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  477:             SKIP;
  478:         ProgHandle ->
  479:             snmpa:send_notification(
  480:               snmp_master_agent, testTrapv22, {erlang_agent_test, self()}),
  481:             receive
  482:                 {snmp_targets, erlang_agent_test, Addresses} ->
  483:                     ct:pal("Notification sent to: ~p~n", [Addresses]),
  484:                     erlang_agent_netsnmp_inform_responses(Addresses)
  485:             end,
  486:             stop_program(ProgHandle)
  487:     end.
  488: 
  489: erlang_agent_netsnmp_inform_responses([]) ->
  490:     receive
  491: 	{snmp_notification, erlang_agent_test, _} = Unexpected ->
  492: 	    ct:pal("Unexpected response: ~p", [Unexpected]),
  493: 	    erlang_agent_netsnmp_inform_responses([])
  494:     after 0 ->
  495: 	    ok
  496:     end;
  497: erlang_agent_netsnmp_inform_responses([Address | Addresses]) ->
  498:     receive
  499: 	{snmp_notification, erlang_agent_test,
  500: 	 {got_response, Address}} ->
  501: 	    ct:pal("Got response from: ~p~n", [Address]),
  502: 	    erlang_agent_netsnmp_inform_responses(Addresses);
  503: 	{snmp_notification, erlang_agent_test,
  504: 	 {no_response, _} = NoResponse} ->
  505: 	    ct:fail(NoResponse)
  506:     end.
  507: 
  508: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  509: %% Internal functions ------------------------------------------------
  510: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  511: 
  512: snmpget(Oid, Transport, Config) ->
  513:     Versions = ?config(snmp_versions, Config),
  514: 
  515:     Args =
  516: 	["-c", "public", net_snmp_version(Versions),
  517: 	 "-m", ":",
  518: 	 "-Cf",
  519: 	 net_snmp_addr_str(Transport),
  520: 	 oid_str(Oid)],
  521:     case start_program(snmpget, Args, none, Config) of
  522:         {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  523:             throw(SKIP);
  524:         ProgHandle ->
  525:             {_, line, Line} = get_program_output(ProgHandle),
  526:             stop_program(ProgHandle),
  527:             binary_to_list(Line)
  528:     end.
  529: 
  530: start_snmptrapd(Mibs, Config) ->
  531:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir, Config),
  532:     MibDir = filename:join(code:lib_dir(snmp), "mibs"),
  533:     Targets = ?config(targets, Config),
  534:     SnmptrapdArgs =
  535: 	["-f", "-Lo", "-C",
  536: 	 "-m", Mibs,
  537: 	 "-M", MibDir++":"++DataDir,
  538: 	 "--disableAuthorization=yes",
  539: 	 "--snmpTrapdAddr=" ++ net_snmp_addr_str(Targets)],
  540:     {ok, StartCheckMP} = re:compile("NET-SNMP version ", [anchored]),
  541:     start_program(snmptrapd, SnmptrapdArgs, StartCheckMP, Config).
  542: 
  543: start_snmpd(Community, SysDescr, Config) ->
  544:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir, Config),
  545:     Targets = ?config(targets, Config),
  546:     Transports = ?config(transports, Config),
  547:     Port = mk_port_number(),
  548:     CommunityArgs =
  549: 	["--rocommunity"++domain_suffix(Domain)++"="
  550: 	 ++Community++" "++inet_parse:ntoa(Ip)
  551: 	 || {Domain, {Ip, _}} <- Targets],
  552: 
  553:     SnmpdArgs =
  554:         ["-f", "-r", %"-Dverbose",
  555:          "-c", filename:join(DataDir, "snmpd.conf"),
  556:          "-C",
  557:          "-Lo",
  558: 	 "-m", ":",
  559: 	 "--sysDescr="++SysDescr,
  560: 	 "--agentXSocket=tcp:localhost:"++integer_to_list(Port)]
  561: 	++ CommunityArgs
  562: 	++ [net_snmp_addr_str(Transports)],
  563:     {ok, StartCheckMP} = re:compile("NET-SNMP version ", [anchored]),
  564:     start_program(snmpd, SnmpdArgs, StartCheckMP, Config).
  565: 
  566: start_program(Prog, Args, StartCheckMP, Config) ->
  567:     ct:pal("Starting program: ~w ~p", [Prog, Args]),
  568:     Path = ?config(Prog, Config),
  569:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir, Config),
  570:     StartWrapper = filename:join(DataDir, "start_stop_wrapper"),
  571:     Parent = self(),
  572:     %% process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  573:     {Pid, Mon} =
  574: 	spawn_monitor(
  575: 	  fun () ->
  576: 		  run_program(Parent, StartWrapper, [Path | Args])
  577: 	  end),
  578:     start_check(Pid, Mon, StartCheckMP).
  579: 
  580: start_check(Pid, Mon, none) ->
  581:     {Pid, Mon};
  582: start_check(Pid, Mon, StartCheckMP) ->
  583:     receive
  584: 	{Pid, line, Line} ->
  585: 	    case re:run(Line, StartCheckMP, [{capture, none}]) of
  586: 		match ->
  587: 		    {Pid, Mon};
  588: 		nomatch ->
  589: 		    start_check(Pid, Mon, StartCheckMP)
  590: 	    end;
  591: 	{'DOWN', Mon, _, _Pid, {skip, Reason} = SKIP} ->
  592: 	    ct:pal("Received DOWN from ~p"
  593:                    "~n   Skip Reason: ~p", [_Pid, Reason]),
  594:             SKIP;
  595: 	{'DOWN', Mon, _, _, Reason} ->
  596: 	    ct:fail("Prog ~p start failed: ~p", [Pid, Reason])
  597:     end.
  598: 
  599: get_program_output({Pid, Mon}) ->
  600:     receive
  601: 	{Pid, _, _} = Msg ->
  602: 	    Msg;
  603: 	{'DOWN', Mon, _, _, Reason} ->
  604: 	    ct:fail("Prog ~p crashed: ~p", [Pid, Reason])
  605:     end.
  606: 
  607: stop_program({Pid, _} = Handle) ->
  608:     Pid ! {self(), stop},
  609:     wait_program_stop(Handle).
  610: 
  611: wait_program_stop({Pid, Mon}) ->
  612:     receive
  613: 	{Pid, exit, ExitStatus} ->
  614: 	    receive
  615: 		{'DOWN', Mon, _, _, _} ->
  616: 		    ExitStatus
  617: 	    end;
  618: 	{'DOWN', Mon, _, _, Reason} ->
  619: 	    ct:fail("Prog stop: ~p", [Reason])
  620:     end.
  621: 
  622: run_program(Parent, StartWrapper, ProgAndArgs) ->
  623:     [Prog | _] = ProgAndArgs,
  624:     Port =
  625: 	open_port(
  626: 	  {spawn_executable, StartWrapper},
  627: 	  [{args, ProgAndArgs}, binary, stderr_to_stdout, {line, 80},
  628: 	   exit_status]),
  629:     ct:pal("Prog ~p started: ~p", [Port, Prog]),
  630:     run_program_loop(Parent, Port, []).
  631: 
  632: run_program_loop(Parent, Port, Buf) ->
  633:     receive
  634: 	{Parent, stop} ->
  635: 	    true = port_command(Port, <<"stop\n">>),
  636: 	    ct:pal("Prog ~p stop", [Port]),
  637: 	    run_program_loop(Parent, Port, Buf);
  638: 	{Port, {data, {Flag, Data}}} ->
  639: 	    case Flag of
  640: 		eol ->
  641: 		    Line  = iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Buf, Data)),
  642:                     ct:pal("Prog ~p output: ~s", [Port, Line]),
  643:                     %% There are potentially many different fail outputs,
  644:                     %% but for now we test for just this one: illegal option
  645:                     IOpt = "illegal option",
  646:                     case string:find(binary_to_list(Line), IOpt) of
  647:                         nomatch ->
  648:                             Parent ! {self(), line, Line},
  649:                             run_program_loop(Parent, Port, []);
  650:                         Line2 ->
  651:                             %% Try to extract the actual illegal option string
  652:                             IOpt2 =
  653:                                 case string:take(
  654:                                        string:prefix(Line2, IOpt), [$-, $ ]) of
  655:                                     {_, Str} when length(Str) > 0 ->
  656:                                         Str;
  657:                                     _X ->
  658:                                         Line2
  659:                                 end,
  660:                             ct:pal("Force program ~p stop", [Port]),
  661:                             true = port_command(Port, <<"stop\n">>),
  662:                             (catch port_close(Port)),
  663:                             exit({skip, {illegal_option, IOpt2}})
  664:                     end;
  665: 		noeol ->
  666: 		    run_program_loop(Parent, Port, [Data | Buf])
  667: 	    end;
  668: 	{Port, {exit_status, ExitStatus}} ->
  669: 	    ct:pal("Prog ~p exit: ~p", [Port, ExitStatus]),
  670: 	    catch port_close(Port),
  671: 	    Parent ! {self(), exit, ExitStatus};
  672: 	Unexpected ->
  673: 	    ct:pal("run_program_loop Unexpected: ~p", [Unexpected]),
  674: 	    run_program_loop(Parent, Port, Buf)
  675:     end.
  676: 
  677: 
  678: agent_app_env(Config) ->
  679:     Dir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  680:     Vsns = ?config(snmp_versions, Config),
  681:     [{versions,         Vsns}, 
  682:      {agent_type,       master},
  683:      {agent_verbosity,  trace},
  684:      {db_dir,           Dir},
  685:      {audit_trail_log,  [{type, read_write},
  686: 			 {dir,  Dir},
  687: 			 {size, {10240, 10}}]},
  688:      {config,           [{dir, Dir},
  689: 			 {force_load, true},
  690: 			 {verbosity,  trace}]}, 
  691:      {local_db,         [{repair,    true},
  692: 			 {verbosity,  silence}]}, 
  693:      {mib_server,       [{verbosity, silence}]},
  694:      {symbolic_store,   [{verbosity, silence}]},
  695:      {note_store,       [{verbosity, silence}]},
  696:      {net_if,           [{verbosity, trace}]}].
  697: 
  698: manager_app_env(Config) ->
  699:     Dir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  700:     Vsns = ?config(snmp_versions, Config),
  701:     NetIfModule = ?config(manager_net_if_module, Config),
  702:     [{versions,         Vsns},
  703:      {audit_trail_log,  [{type, read_write},
  704: 			 {dir, Dir},
  705: 			 {size, {10240, 10}}]},
  706:      {net_if,           [{module, NetIfModule}]},
  707:      {config,           [{dir, Dir},
  708: 			 {db_dir, Dir},
  709: 			 {verbosity, trace}]}
  710:     ].
  711: 
  712: oid_str([1 | Ints]) ->
  713:     "iso." ++ oid_str_tl(Ints);
  714: oid_str(Ints) ->
  715:     oid_str_tl(Ints).
  716: 
  717: oid_str_tl([]) ->
  718:     "";
  719: oid_str_tl([Int]) ->
  720:     integer_to_list(Int);
  721: oid_str_tl([Int | Ints]) ->
  722:     integer_to_list(Int) ++ "." ++ oid_str_tl(Ints).
  723: 
  724: agent_config(Dir, Transports, Targets, Versions) ->
  725:     EngineID = ?AGENT_ENGINE_ID,
  726:     MMS = ?DEFAULT_MAX_MESSAGE_SIZE,
  727:     ok = snmp_config:write_agent_snmp_conf(Dir, Transports, EngineID, MMS),
  728:     ok = snmp_config:write_agent_snmp_context_conf(Dir),
  729:     ok = snmp_config:write_agent_snmp_community_conf(Dir),
  730:     ok =
  731: 	snmp_config:write_agent_snmp_standard_conf(
  732: 	  Dir, "snmp_to_snmpnet_SUITE"),
  733:     ok =
  734: 	snmp_config:write_agent_snmp_target_addr_conf(
  735: 	  Dir, Targets, Versions),
  736:     ok = snmp_config:write_agent_snmp_target_params_conf(Dir, Versions),
  737:     ok = snmp_config:write_agent_snmp_notify_conf(Dir, inform),
  738:     ok = snmp_config:write_agent_snmp_vacm_conf(Dir, Versions, none).
  739: 
  740: manager_config(Dir, Targets) ->
  741:     EngineID = ?MANAGER_ENGINE_ID,
  742:     MMS = ?DEFAULT_MAX_MESSAGE_SIZE,
  743:     ok = snmp_config:write_manager_snmp_conf(Dir, Targets, MMS, EngineID).
  744: 
  745: net_snmp_version([v3 | _]) ->
  746:     "-v3";
  747: net_snmp_version([v2 | _]) ->
  748:     "-v2c";
  749: net_snmp_version([v1 | _]) ->
  750:     "-v1".
  751: 
  752: domain(inet) ->
  753:     transportDomainUdpIpv4;
  754: domain(inet6) ->
  755:     transportDomainUdpIpv6.
  756: 
  757: net_snmp_addr_str([Target | Targets]) ->
  758:     net_snmp_addr_str(Target) ++
  759: 	case Targets of
  760: 	    [] ->
  761: 		[];
  762: 	    [_ | _] ->
  763: 		"," ++ net_snmp_addr_str(Targets)
  764: 	end;
  765: net_snmp_addr_str({transportDomainUdpIpv4, {Addr, Port}}) ->
  766:     "udp:" ++
  767: 	inet_parse:ntoa(Addr) ++ ":" ++
  768: 	integer_to_list(Port);
  769: net_snmp_addr_str({transportDomainUdpIpv6, {Addr, Port}}) ->
  770:     "udp6:[" ++
  771: 	inet_parse:ntoa(Addr) ++ "]:" ++
  772: 	integer_to_list(Port).
  773: 
  774: domain_suffix(transportDomainUdpIpv4) ->
  775:     "";
  776: domain_suffix(transportDomainUdpIpv6) ->
  777:     "6".
  778: 
  779: mk_port_number() ->
  780:     {ok, Socket} = gen_udp:open(0, [{reuseaddr, true}]),
  781:     {ok, PortNum} = inet:port(Socket),
  782:     ok = gen_udp:close(Socket),
  783:     PortNum.
  784:
